Key Match Events: A flagrant foul was called against Hawks guard Garrison Matthews for what looked like a hard forearm to the mid-section of Pelicans guard Jose Alvarado.
Pelicans players appeared to ask officials to assess Daniels a technical foul for unsportsmanlike conduct, but Daniels did not receive one.
Post-Match Reflections: Daniels said it was a tough moment for him when he first learned New Orleans was trading him.
Nance said that as he went into his shooting motion from behind the 3-point arc, Pelicans players were yelling, 'Hell, no!'
Daniels said, 'Even if I wasn’t 100%, I was going to make sure I’d be back for this game’.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game got chippy at times, including a flagrant foul against Hawks guard Garrison Matthews.
Pelicans guard Jose Alvarado was restrained by teammates as he advanced toward Matthews, yelling.
Others: Daniels finished with 16 points in what was also his return from a two-game absence because of a right hip strain that he said was no longer bothering him.
Nance scored 14 points during Sunday's game.
The Atlanta Hawks won 126-111 against the New Orleans Pelicans.
